title: Skilled — Sponsored visa (subclass 886)
summary: This page provides information for applicants, visa holders, and sponsors involved with the Skilled — Sponsored visa (subclass 886), which closed to new applications on 1 January 2013. It explains post‑lodgement processes, obligations, decision outcomes, and visa holder entitlements.

visa_details.description: A permanent residence visa for skilled applicants sponsored by an eligible relative or state/territory government agency.

applicants_information.applicable_to: people who have already applied for the Skilled — Sponsored visa (subclass 886)
applicants_information.application_assessment_basis: assessed against requirements outlined in the page

after_applying.acknowledgement: Acknowledge receipt of application and documents
after_applying.case_officer_assignment: A case officer is assigned to review the application

bridging_visas.bridging_visa_a: Allows lawful stay in Australia while application is processed
bridging_visas.bridging_visa_b: Can be applied for if travel outside Australia is required during processing

health_and_character_requirements.process: Department will contact the applicant when health or character documents are needed

debts_to_government.requirement: Applicant must have no outstanding debts to the Australian Government or must have made arrangements to repay them before the visa can be granted

department_requests.response_requirement: Must provide information by the specified date
department_requests.consequence_of_non_response: Decision may be made based on available information

third_party_information.notification: Applicant is usually given the opportunity to comment on information that could lead to a refusal

withdrawing_application.method: Submit letter or email requesting withdrawal
information_required: file reference number, client ID, or Transaction Reference Number
withdrawing_application.signature_requirement: All applicants aged 18 or older must sign the withdrawal request

change_of_circumstances.link_reference: See how to tell us if your situation changes

information_provided: when the visa can be used
any conditions attached to the visa
time limit for lodging an appeal
if_refused.sponsor_review_rights: Where applicable, sponsor can apply for review

contact_information.processing_centre: Adelaide General Skilled Migration (GSM) processing centre

visa_holders_information.applicable_to: people already granted the Skilled — Sponsored visa (subclass 886)
visa_holders_information.checking_entitlements: Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) available for free

entitlements: apply for Australian citizenship if eligible
sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residence
travel to and from Australia for five years from visa grant date (after which a resident return visa or another visa is needed)

state_or_territory_nomination_requiremen: live in nominating state or territory for a specified minimum time
inform state or territory of address before and after arrival
complete surveys and provide post-arrival information when asked

sponsor_information.applicable_to: people who applied to sponsor a relative for this visa

support_required_for_two_years: support to help children attend English classes if needed
information and advice including employment-related information to help settlement
